summary: The Artemis Act of 2025, introduced in the House of Representatives, proposes an amendment to the Immigration and Nationality Act. Specifically, it addresses expedited removal procedures and provides an exception for individuals from countries designated as "countries of concern" by the Secretary of State, which includes countries of particular concern and special watch list countries under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The bill aims to modify existing removal policies to account for individuals from these specific nations.
